body.p:
Williams-burg March 5th 1865 --
Hon. James R. Page assistant secretary of state

Enclosed you will receive my petition to his excellency I want help and I will remember the favour in gratitude while memory remains to me those who assist me please present my petition to his excellency & procure a pardon for me and Ann Shelby if it can be done
Your Petitioner Encloses two Dollars which he understands are necessary for the payment of fees & stamp on petition he has no stamps,

William Patrick is a first rate clever man and by being intoxicated he has been led in to this dificulty his wife is clever they are honest industrious people and I should like exceedingly to see this fault of Williams hid and an investigation of it would do more injury than good to the community William Patrick is most esteemed in this county very popular in deed send your answer to George W. Lyttle

I am truly your friend
D, Y, Lyttle
